item.title: Doubao scraping other appsâ€™ information and being blocked by major apps feels a lot like: - after the invention of printing, churches banned it becau...
item.description:
Doubao scraping other appsâ€™ information and being blocked by major apps feels a lot like:

- after the invention of printing, churches banned it because many printing houses were taking away their business

- after cars appeared, the horse-carriage industry demanded that someone walk in front of cars with a red flag

- when electric lights appeared, gas companies tried to stop electric companies from laying wires

- when Uber appeared, taxi companies went on strike

- Waymo cars were smashed by Uber drivers

Consumer-side demand is ultimately unstoppable. In the long run, we build a new world on top of these unstoppable trends.

item.title: RT Solstice: We are aware of some major volatility in the secondary market for USX tonight. The Solstice team can confirm the underlying NAV and the c...
item.description:
RTâ€‚Solstice
We are aware of some major volatility in the secondary market for USX tonight.

The Solstice team can confirm the underlying NAV and the custodied assets backing USX on the Solstice side remain entirely unaffected and >100% collateralized. We have requested an immediate and additional third-party attestation report that the team will post once available.

This is purely a secondary market liquidity issue that both the Solstice team and our market makers are addressing immediately. We will continue to inject liquidity into the secondary markets to ensure stability.

1:1 redemptions in the primary market remain fully available.

The key point currently is that Solstice internally remains unaffected and this is purely a secondary market dynamic.

item.title: Yesterday I open-sourced polymarket-sdk for @Polymarket https://github.com/cyl19970726/poly-sdk Thanks for the support â€” the repo already has 223 sta...
item.description:
Yesterday I open-sourced polymarket-sdk for @Polymarket
https://github.com/cyl19970726/poly-sdk

Thanks for the support â€” the repo already has 223 stars and 63 forks â¤ï¸

Today, we shipped a major update.

The SDK now covers almost everything you need to build on Polymarket:
ğŸ”„ Real-time arbitrage detection (WebSocket-based)
ğŸ“Š Smart money analysis â€” track top traders and strategies
ğŸ’± Trading integration (GTC / GTD / FOK / FAK)
ğŸ” On-chain ops: split, merge, redeem CTF tokens
ğŸŒ‰ Cross-chain deposits from Ethereum, Solana, Bitcoin
ğŸ’° DEX swaps on Polygon (QuickSwap V3)
ğŸ“ˆ Market analytics: K-lines, signals, volume

Todayâ€™s highlight: ArbitrageService ğŸ‘€

We now officially support Polymarket arbitrage.
The idea is simple:

- If buying a YES+NO pair costs < 1 USDC, buy both and redeem on-chain
- If selling a YES+NO pair yields > 1 USDC, mint a pair for 1 USDC and sell

The hard part is execution.
In real markets, arbitrage windows are short â€”
thereâ€™s often no time to do on-chain actions when profit appears.
So the ArbitrageService uses dynamic position management:

- Maintain USDC â†” YES/NO positions
- Keep USDC ratio between 20%â€“80%
- Always ready to buy or sell immediately when opportunities show up

Handling partial fills

Partial fills are inevitable and can leave you with unbalanced YES/NO positions.

The service automatically:
- Sells the excess side
- Keeps YES and NO close to 1:1
- Exposes a settlePosition helper to clean up exposure anytime

Full arbitrage theory + implementation details are documented in the repo.

GitHub: https://github.com/cyl19970726/poly-sdk
Arbitrage docs: https://github.com/cyl19970726/poly-sdk/blob/main/docs/arbitrage.md
Our Project: @catalystdotfun
Open-source, and happy hacking

item.author: TingHuâ™ª

item.title: RT Brevis: BREV is the core utility and governance asset of Brevis, serving multiple functions within Brevis ProverNet, as detailed in the announcemen...
item.description:
RTâ€‚Brevis
BREV is the core utility and governance asset of Brevis, serving multiple functions within Brevis ProverNet, as detailed in the announcement and whitepaper. To recap, $BREV serves as:

ğŸ’°Payment Medium
All fees in Brevis ProverNet are paid in BREV. This covers proof generation, verification, and settlement across zkVM execution, ZK Data Coprocessor queries, and recursive aggregation.

Pricing is determined through a dynamic auction process between proof requesters and provers. Developers pay BREV for compute, provers earn BREV as revenue for delivering verified results.

ProverNet is initially deployed on Base. As network activity grows and reaches sufficient scale, ProverNet will migrate to a dedicated Brevis rollup. At that point, BREV becomes the native gas token for all network transactions including staking, proof submissions, and job settlements.

ğŸ”Staking and Incentive Alignment
Provers must stake BREV or receive delegated stake to qualify for jobs. Staking serves three purposes: Sybil resistance, economic alignment through slashing risk, and capacity signaling where larger stakes unlock access to higher-value workloads.

Token holders who do not run infrastructure can delegate BREV to professional provers and share in proving fee revenue. Delegators earn based on prover performance and must monitor reliability, as delegated stakes are subject to slashing if service-level agreements are breached.

Slashable violations include missing deadlines, exceeding proof size limits, or failing to meet agreed security levels. The slashing rate starts low at 1% and will be adjusted through governance.

ğŸ—³ï¸Governance
BREV holders vote on critical network parameters. Initial governed parameters include maximum acceptable proof size (under 1 MB), minimum cryptographic security level (above 100-bit), slashing percentage (starting at 1%), and auction market fee (3% of requester payments).

Today weâ€™re publishing $BREV tokenomics. Full details here:

https://blog.brevis.network/2025/12/24/introducing-brev-token/

robotics æ—¥æŠ¥ 12.21 by grok (fact check yourself!)

1. Crypto & DePIN
Note: Filtered for high-signal technical/project updates.
BitRobot Network (@BitRobotNetwork)
æ ¸å¿ƒè¿›å±•: TeleArms private beta waitlist paused due to huge response, focusing on current testers and refining the platform for scaling.
ä»·å€¼è§£è¯»: This indicates strong community interest in open robotics data collection, accelerating DePIN incentives for embodied AI training data at the intersection of crypto and physical robots.
Source: https://x.com/BitRobotNetwork/status/2002384088594784387
GEODNET (@GEODNET)
æ ¸å¿ƒè¿›å±•: Investing heavily in global RTK infrastructure, interoperable positioning standards, and deployment hardware to support drone-based robotics scaling.
ä»·å€¼è§£è¯»: Enhances precision for autonomous drones in unstructured environments, positioning DePIN as the foundational layer for real-world robot economies and data generation.
Source: https://x.com/GEODNET/status/2002444436832465332

2. å­¦ç•Œå‰æ²¿ (Academia)
PolaRiS: Scalable Real-to-Sim Evaluations for Generalist Robot Policies
æŠ€æœ¯çªç ´: Proposes a framework for scalable real-to-sim evaluations of generalist robot policies, enabling efficient testing and development.
Source: https://arxiv.org/abs/2512.16881
ReinforceGen: Hybrid Skill Policies with Automated Data Generation and Reinforcement Learning
æŠ€æœ¯çªç ´: Introduces a hybrid approach combining automated data generation with reinforcement learning to develop skill policies for robots.
Source: https://arxiv.org/abs/2512.16861
PhysBrain: Human Egocentric Data as a Bridge from Vision Language Models to Physical Intelligence
æŠ€æœ¯çªç ´: Leverages human egocentric data to connect vision-language models with physical intelligence in robotic systems.
Source: https://arxiv.org/abs/2512.16793

3. äº§ä¸šä¸å·¨å¤´ (Industry & Big Tech)
BattleBots Arena
è½åœ°åŠ¨æ€: Humanoid robots set for first-ever fight in Las Vegas on January 6, marking a milestone in real-world deployment demos.
Source: https://x.com/LasVegasLocally/status/2002417634546200620
Unitree
è½åœ°åŠ¨æ€: Unitree G1 demonstrated in AI-powered gun test scenario, showcasing balance and recovery capabilities in practical use cases.
Source: https://www.pcgamer.com/software/ai/youtube-channel-discovers-a-good-use-case-for-ai-powered-robots-shooting-youtubers/

Signal-to-Noise Summary
The most important trend is the convergence of DePIN infrastructure investments with academic advances in sim-to-real frameworks, accelerating scalable embodied AI deployments across crypto and traditional robotics.

item.title: RT Hyper Foundation: The Hyper Foundation is proposing a validator vote to formally recognize the Assistance Fund HYPE as burned, removing the tokens ...
item.description:
RTâ€‚Hyper Foundation
The Hyper Foundation is proposing a validator vote to formally recognize the Assistance Fund HYPE as burned, removing the tokens permanently from the circulating and total supply.

For context, the Assistance Fund converts trading fees to HYPE in a fully automated manner as part of the L1 execution. The Assistance Fund uses the system address 0xfefefefefefefefefefefefefefefefefefefefe. Similar to the zero address, the Assistance Fund system address has never had a private key with control over its funds. Funds are mathematically irretrievable without a hard fork.

By voting â€œYes,â€ validators agree to treat the Assistance Fund HYPE as burned. No onchain action is required, as the tokens are already in a system address with no private key. This vote is binding social consensus to never authorize a protocol upgrade to access this address.

Voting process:
+ Validators should signal their intent in the governance forum by December 21 at 04:00 UTC (i.e., reply with Yes or No)
+ Users can stake to a validator who matches their view by December 24 at 04:00 UTC
+ The result will be based on stake-weighted consensus as of December 24 at 04:00 UTC

item.title: Some of my opinions: the comparison between trading volume and oi is still inaccurate. Why? It's very simple. The points rules of each project are dif...
item.description:
Some of my opinions: the comparison between trading volume and oi is still inaccurate. Why? It's very simple. The points rules of each project are different. For example, grvt encourages oi a few weeks ago, so farmers will choose a higher position volume, and why is the ratio of pac and ext so exaggerated? Because the points rules basically don't look at the position volume, only the trading volume and the transaction fee profit and loss ratio.


pika2zero:â€‚Pacifica and Extended are the most overfarmed, wash-traded perps DEXES out there by a wide margin. Almost nobody uses these to trade organically. Even Aster looks better now

I ranked the most inorganic perps dexes on the market. and i was shocked to find some of my airdrop farms

item.description:
Thereâ€™s no asset in the world better than ETH for killing whales.

I realized this earlier this year when ETH crashed from 4k to 1.5K, after I watched a lot of whales get liquidated at prices they thought were absolutely safe.

The rebound from the lows back to new highs was basically driven by DAT companies buying since nothing really changed on the narrative side. Now that the DAT narrative has collapsed, ETH should go back to the price it actually deserves.
